intro: Ambrosia paniculata, commonly known as the yellow ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its dense, woody structure and its ability to thrive in coastal and sandy soils. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles, which bloom during the dry season. Its leaves are typically narrow and革质 (leathery), providing drought resistance. Ambrosia paniculata is also valued for its hard, durable wood, which has been used in traditional construction and crafts.
